name: Green Hell VR

reviews:
Green Hell VR deserves much more love – but be warned!

I believe this game deserves way more positive reviews. If you have a very powerful PC, it's easily one of the best survival games you can currently play in VR. The problem is, it's terribly optimized, so you really need high-end hardware – ideally one of the newest 3D CPUs and at least an RTX 4090.

Personally, I wasn’t able to play it properly until I upgraded to a 5700X3D this year. Most VR games are very demanding, especially on the CPU. Of course, a strong GPU is also necessary, but without a powerful processor, your GPU won’t be used to its full potential.

And honestly, this kind of survival game makes no sense outside of VR. I’ve also played the regular (non-VR) version of Green Hell, and it just doesn’t compare. It lacks the same atmosphere and immersion, and it never will come close to the VR experience.

So, if you're thinking about buying this game, make sure you have a high-end CPU and GPU first – otherwise, you’ll end up being just another frustrated player leaving a negative review.

short_description: Green Hell VR is an Open World Survival game set in the Amazon rainforest, based on the successful PC title Green Hell. You are left alone in the jungle with no food or equipment. To survive, you must learn real-life survival techniques, and crafting weapons can be a matter of life and death
